page.title: 06Churches in Lawshall Area.
page.content: In this area we have 3 places of Worship. In Lawshall village is All Saints Parish Church, which was record- ed in the Domesday Book of 1086, althoughwe cannot be certain it was the same building as the earliest we can date it is the Early English Period 1166-1266. At present we are without an incumbent due to the retirement of the Rector in June 1984,but the Parish has been looked after by the Rector-in- Charge of the adjoining Parish, but in September 1985 a new Curate-in-Charge will be taking up residence in the rectory.The church is now in a poor state of repair,the tower needs 30,000 pounds to repair it,and many fund rais- ing events are taking place at present. Most recently a Flower Festival in July The church was beautifully decorated with flowers,each display portraying a village craft or trade.
